contentrichtext.text: {{lunar crater data| latitude=5.2| N_or_S=N| longitude=117.1| E_or_W=E| diameter=26 km| depth=1.8 km| colong=243| eponym=[[Vincenzo Viviani]]}} '''Viviani''' is a small [[Moon|lunar]] [[impact crater]] that lies on the [[Far side (Moon)|far side]] of the [[Moon]]. It is located due west of the prominent crater [[King (crater)|King]], and just to the southeast of [[Katchalsky (crater)|Katchalsky]]. This is a roughly circular, bowl-shaped crater with a well-defined rim edge and an inner wall that is wider along the southeastern half. A small crater has cut into the southern rim edge, and another small crater is attached to the exterior along the east. The inner walls are simple slopes that run down to the relatively level and featureless floor. ==Satellite craters== By convention these features are identified on lunar maps by placing the letter on the side of the crater midpoint that is closest to Viviani. {| class="wikitable" !width="25%" style="background:#eeeeee;" |Viviani !width="25%" style="background:#eeeeee;" |Latitude !width="25%" style="background:#eeeeee;" |Longitude !width="25%" style="background:#eeeeee;" |Diameter |- |align="center"|N |align="center"|3.5째 N |align="center"|116.5째 E |align="center"|16 km |- |align="center"|P |align="center"|4.1째 N |align="center"|116.5째 E |align="center"|15 km |} ==In popular culture== Viviani, along with another crater, [[Bingham (crater)|Bingham]], is referenced in the [[Midsomer Murders]] season 14 episode 'Dark Secrets'. ==References== {{Lunar crater references}} [[Category:Impact craters on the Moon]] {{Moon-crater-stub}}
